body:
Welp this happen:

So..... a 6 minute video takes 200 minutes to upload? (Started out with 200 minutes)

Information of the video uploading...

Size: around 900MB
My upload speed: around 2MBPS
Video length: 6 minutes
Motion blur: Negative
Transitions: Type: Portals | Portal Type: High def Transition :: Total transitions: 8

Thats basically the info... If anyone can help (that knows what is going on) that would be great
Btw this is my 3rd time trying to upload x|

*If this is a "Spam" topic, i do not mean for it to be, i just need help :P

title: Erm... Any help from youtubers?

replies.body: I'm not uploading anymore because of this -_- i cant upload a video above 15 minutes cuz it'll take around 2 days....

replies.body: It's either your internet, your computer, or YouTube, or even a combination of multiple reasons. I have fairly fast internet so a 3-4 minute video takes around... 8+ minutes to upload. A normal video (15 mins+) usually takes up to 2 hours.
replies.body_tagged: It's either your internet, your computer, or YouTube, or even a combination of multiple reasons. I have fairly fast internet so a 3-4 minute video takes around... 8+ minutes to upload. A normal video (15 mins+) usually takes up to 2 hours.

replies.body: Okay thats weird... I uploaded a 24 minute video in less than 50 minutes o.o
replies.body_tagged: Okay thats weird... I uploaded a 24 minute video in less than 50 minutes o.o

replies.body:
It's possible that you quit/stopped some applications/programs which allowed your computer to focus more on uploading. It may also be that no one else was using your internet, so your upload speeds were faster.

Or hey, it might be YouTube :P Technology is weird and tends to do unexpected things ;)
replies.body_tagged:

Or hey, it might be YouTube :P Technology is weird and tends to do unexpected things ;)

replies.body:
I recommend using an application called Handbrake. Handbrake compresses for 900 MB to 300 MB or whatever and makes the upload so much quicker. There is tutorials about the download and how to use it, and plus it's free! 

I hope I could help :D
replies.body_tagged:

I hope I could help :D

replies.body:
My upload speed is very slow as well. 
Years ago, YouTube allowed you to upload multiple videos at once, and much faster than 1 video uploads today, but because there are more and more YouTubers, and more videos being uploaded, YouTube cannot handle this large amount of videos being uploaded at the same time, so it processes them slowly.

Sorry, but this happens to everyone, trust me, I know. :/
replies.body_tagged:
My upload speed is very slow as well.

Sorry, but this happens to everyone, trust me, I know. :/

It compresses videos extremely well while still keeping good quality.

replies.body: Vesplesk101, this happened to me and MiningFlamingo a very annoying amount of times, my 15 - 20 minute episodes take around 9 hours of leaving my computer open on the upload page... MiningFlamingo downloaded an application .- HandBrake, where it compresses your video to a smaller size, but doesn't do anything to the length or quality, although about 40% of the time you may have to make a few attempts, but yeah, that can make a 10 hour upload reduced to 60 - 80 minutes, if it works properly :)
replies.body_tagged: Vesplesk101, this happened to me and MiningFlamingo a very annoying amount of times, my 15 - 20 minute episodes take around 9 hours of leaving my computer open on the upload page... replies.body: I never trust how long youtube says it will take to upload a video. Within 3 seconds it can go from a 1 hour upload to a 3 minute upload and back again. Typically, uploads will take a while and tend to slow down your computer while the upload is in process. I suggest just turning off your monitor and letting the video upload over night. That's what I do.
replies.body_tagged: I never trust how long youtube says it will take to upload a video. Within 3 seconds it can go from a 1 hour upload to a 3 minute upload and back again. Typically, uploads will take a while and tend to slow down your computer while the upload is in process. I suggest just turning off your monitor and letting the video upload over night. That's what I do.
